definition: A category of texts sharing conventions of form, style, and subject matter

positive_examples: The lab report genre requires methods, results, and discussion sections.
Genre conventions for cover letters differ from those for personal essays.
Readers bring genre expectations: a thriller promises suspense, a romance promises love.
Genre-bending works deliberately violate or combine conventional expectations.
negative_examples: The text is a type of writing.
There are different kinds of texts.
training_hints.disambiguation: Systematic conventions for text types, not just categories
